Aside from cablc, Christie is thinking about magazines. She'd like to start a magazine for women. "One particular of the items that intrigues me as a likelihood," she says, "is a kind of combination efTort in each cable and print that would try to be as influential and exciting for ladies as Playboy is for males. It would have to have some sexual subject material. I would want to have humor and romance and entertainment." There's been some discuss that Playboy may possibly buy Sawy, a magazine for executive ladies, but Christie states. "I doubt it," and Hefner states no one has even talked to him about it.

Will income-abundant Playboy purchase again its stock from the public and go private? "It's possible, but it isn't some thing that we're going to do in the following year," Christie informed me. "I feel the initial issue we have to do is to get the company in a position exactly where it's operating a beneficial cash flow and developing up a lot more cash, instead than commence by depleting drastically the income we have in order to buy up our stock. That's something we'll look at in a 12 months or so." The gain of going private, in accordance to Christie, would be. "more management versatility. I think there is a tendency to demand that a public company have a auarter-by-quarter earnings boost. That is not necessarily the greatest way to operate a business it leads to a sort of brief-term pondering." Then Christie touched on a sore level: As a public business, "there are a great deal of additional costs that we incur in purchase to preserve separate what is Hefner's personalized use of the mansion from the company's use." These charges could be removed by likely private then there would be no stringent accounting to stockholders.

"I'm proud of the issues that I think I've accomplished," Hugh Hefner informed me. Via his magazine, he believes, he has served to transform "the values and attitudes of culture. I consider it's most evident in the sexual area, but I imply sex in the broader perception social attitudes towards intercourse. I believe it is a very distinct entire world from the one particular I grew up in and one particular in which people are more likely to locate, in that regard, a lot more pleasure. I feel lifestyle is better in the bedroom right now simply because Hugh Hefner was here."

Even though one particular may possibly dismiss his vision, as 1 journalist just lately did, as just "1 long damp dream," the guy and the fantasy match. The vision was profitable and worthwhile, and Hefner appears at ease defending his development, and truly proud of it.

Christie is neither as glib nor as at ease as Hef when she begins to defend Playboy. She seems to come to feel she must justify herself and make her father s magazine "meaningful."

"Christie really should be running the Ladies' Residence Journal says 1 apprehensive editor. "She's getting Hefs line that Playboy is excellent for ladies. She's turn into his tiny mouthpiece. How she lives with herself, I don't know. You can't be a rampant feminist and work for Playboy. It helps make us look ridiculous."

Ideology aside, Christie's ultimate good results will turn on her untested capacity and on her father's equally untested willingness to grant her real authority. For all his efforts to expand the business, Hefner has essentially had only 1 media success-Playboy magazine. Now he and Christie will have to see no matter whether they can nurture that base into an revolutionary organization for the 1980s.
